reason: The node's Turaev-Viro formula is schematically imprecise in two ways: (1) it omits the normalization factor D^{-2v} (where D^2 = sum_j [2j+1]_q^2 and v relates to the number of vertices), which is essential for triangulation-independence and hence topological invariance; (2) it writes bare {6j}_q for the tetrahedral weight instead of |{6j}_q|^2 (the squared modulus), which is the standard TV construction. Without the normalization, the state sum is NOT a topological invariant, contradicting the node's own claim. Additionally, the spin truncation j <= (r-2)/2 is correct, as is the characterization as a q-deformation of Ponzano-Regge. The transition from q > 0 real (the regime of the rest of the proof tree) to q = exp(2pi i/r) (complex, |q|=1) is not discussed in this node, though this is arguably the responsibility of the parent node 1.4. Overall: correct qualitative content, but the explicit formula needs correction to support the topological invariance claim.
